body_html: @apaszke I have resolved the method vs function comment you made. The "not enough", I mean, previously t1.masked_scatter(t2, t3) does not support broadcasting on t1, therefore creating a tensor t3 with t1.numel() elements is large enough to make sure that it has more elements than the number of 1 masks. But now since t1 could be expanded, t1.numel() elements is no longer large enough for t3.
body_text: @apaszke I have resolved the method vs function comment you made. The "not enough", I mean, previously t1.masked_scatter(t2, t3) does not support broadcasting on t1, therefore creating a tensor t3 with t1.numel() elements is large enough to make sure that it has more elements than the number of 1 masks. But now since t1 could be expanded, t1.numel() elements is no longer large enough for t3.
body: @apaszke I have resolved the method vs function comment you made. The "not enough", I mean, previously `t1.masked_scatter(t2, t3)` does not support broadcasting on `t1`, therefore creating a tensor `t3` with `t1.numel()` elements is large enough to make sure that it has more elements than the number of 1 masks. But now since `t1` could be expanded, `t1.numel()` elements is no longer large enough for `t3`.
